metadata.title: CVE-2021-20235 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description: There's a flaw in the zeromq server in versions before 4.3.3 insrc/decoder_allocators.hpp. The decoder static allocator could have itssized changed, but the buffer would remain the same as it is a staticbuffer. A remote, unauthenticated attacker who sends a crafted request tothe zeromq server could trigger a buffer overflow WRITE of arbitrary dataif CURVE/ZAP authentication is not enabled. The greatest impact of thisflaw is to application availability, data integrity, and confidentiality.

criterions.comment: zeromq3: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
